roleset.name: to decide or agree to do, endeavor

example.name: undertake-v: transitive
example.text: The meeting , which is expected to draw 20,000 to Bangkok , was going to be held at the Central Plaza Hotel , but the government balked at the hotel 's conditions for undertaking necessary expansion .

example.name: undertake-v: passive with purpose clause
example.text: Ohbayashi officials said the purchase was undertaken to participate in ventures in and around New York City .

propbank.arg: to participate in ventures in and around New York City

example.name: undertake-v: all arguments
example.text: Mr. Furuta did n't disclose further details of the arrangement at a news conference , but said the project would be undertaken with Ford 's European subsidiary .

example.name: undertake-v: arg1 as infinitive
example.text: David Boren , the Intelligence Committee chairman , is upset that someone leaked a letter to the committee from the Reagan administration suggesting that the U.S. would undertake to warn Panamanian thug Manuel Noriega if it got wind of an impending coup that might result in his assassination .

propbank.arg: to warn Panamanian thug Manuel Noriega if it got wind of an impending coup that might result in his assassination

example.name: undertaking-n: both args
example.text: In their undertaking of social and political issues , the band introduced the term " Afro - German " in to the context of German hip hop

example.name: undertaking-n: with COM
example.text: As part of their undertaking with FPIC , Piquero said they expect to finish a complete project design by next month

roleset.note: UNDERTAKE-V NOTES: VN, FN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls begin-55.1-1, confront-98. (from undertake.01-v)
UNDERTAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on undertake-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls begin-55.1, confront-98. (from undertaking.01-n)
This frame differs from undertake-v in the omission of the co-undertaker as a numbered arg. It is expected to be infrequent, and can be covered by argM-COM. (from undertaking.01-n)
